page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE AREA IS FAIRLY FLAT, LOW-LYING FARMLAND DRAINED BY THE RIVER YEO, WHICH FLOWS FROM BLAGDON LAKE TO THE SEVERN ESTUARY. THE NORTHERN PART OF THE AREA IS MORE HILLY AND LARGELY COVERED BY MIXED WOODLAND. THE TWO MAIN SETTLEMENTS ARE CONGRESBURY AND WRINGTON. BOTH HAVE BASIC AMENITIES SUCH AS SHOPS, PUBS, GARAGES, CHURCHES AND PRIMARY SCHOOLS. THERE ARE ALSO TWO LINEAR HAMLETS, IWOOD AND UDLEY. THE ONLY MAIN ROAD IN THE BLOCK IS THE A370 THROUGH CONGRESBURY, RUNNING BETWEEN BRISTOL AND WESTON-SUPER-MARE. TODAY THERE IS NO RAILWAY. BRISTOL LULSGATE AIRPORT IS TO THE NORTH AND PLANES CAN OFTEN BE SEEN OR HEARD IN THE WRINGTON AREA. CADBURY HILL FORT AND WRINGTON CHURCH ARE PLACES OF HISTORICAL INTEREST.
